content.text: Write the number one hundred and three thousand eight hundred and six in figures
Measure the length of the line \(AB\) in millimetres
Mark the midpoint, \(M,\) of the line \(AB.\)
Draw a line through \(M\) that is perpendicular to the line \(AB.\)
Simplify
Work out the area of a rectangle that is \(9.5 \text{m}\) long and \(6.8 \text{m}\) wide
The probability of picking a red sweet from a bag is 0.05
Find the probability of not picking a red sweet
Measure the bearing of point \(B\) from point \(A\)
Work out the value of \(\frac{mk^3}{\sqrt{3}}\) when \(m = 4\) and \(k = 7\)
A box, in the shape of a cuboid, has volume \(357 \text{cm}^3\)
It has a length of \(8.5 \text{cm}\) and a width of \(6 \text{cm}\)
Calculate the height of the box
\(PQRS\) is a quadrilateral
\(RST\) is a straight line
Find angle \(PST\)
Complete the stem-and-leaf diagram for the 12 parcels
Key: 0 | 3 represents 0.3 kg
Find the median
These are the masses, in kg, of 12 parcels
Write down the coordinates of point \(P\)
Mark point \(Q\) on the grid
Find \(\overrightarrow{QR}\)
\(\overrightarrow{QR} = \left( \begin{array}{c} \\ \\ \end{array} \right)\)
Complete this statement
The grid shows point \(P\) and point \(R\)
Simplify
On one of the eight days there are 410 visitors
Find the total amount spent by visitors during this day
Information for the ninth day is shown in the table
Plot this information on the scatter diagram
Draw a line of best fit on the scatter diagram
On the tenth day the total amount spent is $22 000
Estimate the number of visitors on this day
The scatter diagram shows the number of visitors and the total amount spent, in thousands of dollars, at a zoo on each of eight days
Calculate the height, \(h\), of the triangle
The triangle is one face of a square-based pyramid
On the \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^2\) grid, draw a net of this pyramid
Factorise completely
The \(n\)th term of a sequence is \(n^{2} - 1\)
Find the first three terms of this sequence
Complete this statement with a geometrical term
Calculate angle \(ABC\)
The diagram shows two right-angled triangles, \(ABC\) and \(PQR\)
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 32 and 40
Joe thinks of a number, \(n\), trebles it, and subtracts 5
The result is 22
Write this as an equation in terms of \(n\), and solve the equation
Find the gradient of line \(L\)
Dominic asks 30 students in his class if they are right-handed or left-handed
7 students are left-handed
Work out the expected number of left-handed students in the whole school of 960 students
Without using a calculator, work out \(4\frac{1}{6} - 1\frac{7}{8}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
Solve the simultaneous equations
You must show all your working
